content.user_title: Audit Quality Management Systems with ISO 13485 Expertise
content.value_statement: This skill provides expert guidance for planning, executing, and managing ISO 13485 audits. It includes risk-based audit planning tools, nonconformity tracking, and CAPA integration workflows for medical device organizations.
actual_capabilities: Design and manage risk-based audit programs aligned with ISO 13485 requirements
Plan and execute process-based audits across management, core, and support processes
Identify, classify, and document nonconformities with appropriate severity levels
Integrate audit findings with CAPA processes for corrective action verification
Prepare organizations for external regulatory inspections and certification audits
Analyze audit program performance and identify continuous improvement opportunities
limitations: Does not replace human auditor judgment for complex compliance decisions
Does not access external regulatory databases for real-time updates
Does not execute actual audit procedures on live systems
Does not provide legal or regulatory certification services

use_cases.title: Plan Annual Audit Programs
use_cases.description: Develop comprehensive risk-based audit schedules and auditor assignments for the fiscal year

use_cases.title: Prepare and Execute Audits
use_cases.description: Follow structured audit checklists and methodology for ISO 13485 clause-specific assessments

use_cases.title: Ready for External Audits
use_cases.description: Prepare documentation and conduct mock audits before certification body inspections

prompt_templates.title: Plan QMS Audit Schedule
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create an annual audit schedule for our ISO 13485 quality management system. We have 12 main processes including design control, purchasing, production, and post-market surveillance. Identify high-risk processes that need quarterly audits versus annual surveillance audits.

prompt_templates.title: Prepare Audit Checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive audit checklist for ISO 13485 Clause 7.3 Design Controls. Include specific questions to verify design and development planning, inputs, outputs, review, verification, validation, and design transfer activities.

prompt_templates.title: Document Nonconformity
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me document a major nonconformity finding for design control procedures. The auditee has design history files with incomplete design verification records for a Class II medical device. Structure the finding with requirement, evidence, and root cause description.

prompt_templates.title: Plan CAPA Verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a follow-up audit plan to verify the effectiveness of corrective actions for a documented nonconformity about training records. What specific evidence should the auditor collect to confirm that training gaps have been permanently addressed?

output_examples.input: Create a risk-based audit plan for our medical device company with 8 high-priority processes
output: High-Priority Processes (Quarterly): Design Controls, Production Controls, CAPA System
Medium-Priority Processes (Semi-Annual): Purchasing, Document Control, Training
Standard Processes (Annual): Management Review, Customer Feedback, Infrastructure

output_examples.input: What are the key audit questions for ISO 13485 Clause 8.2.1 Monitoring and Measurement?
output: How does the organization determine customer satisfaction metrics?
What procedures ensure monitoring and measurement equipment is calibrated?
How are results of monitoring and measurement analyzed and evaluated?
What records demonstrate compliance with acceptance criteria?

output_examples.input: Help me prepare for an FDA inspection of our QMS
output: Document Readiness: Design History Files, CAPA Records, Training Records
Common FDA Findings: Design changes not documented, CAPA root cause incomplete
Interview Preparation: Key messages for management and floor personnel

best_practices: Use risk-based audit planning to focus resources on high-impact processes and regulatory requirements
Document all audit evidence objectively with specific record references and timestamps
Link every audit finding to specific ISO 13485 clauses and organizational procedures
anti_patterns: Avoid conducting audits without predefined checklists and objective criteria
Do not rely solely on document review without observing actual process execution
Never skip auditor independence verification and competency assessment

faq.question: What ISO 13485 clauses require special audit attention?
faq.answer: Clauses 7.1 (Resource management), 7.3 (Design controls), 7.4 (Purchasing), 8.2 (Monitoring and measurement), and 8.5 (Control of nonconforming product) typically require detailed audit focus.

faq.question: How often should internal audits occur?
faq.answer: ISO 13485 requires planned intervals for audits. High-risk processes typically need quarterly audits while lower-risk processes may use annual or extended cycles based on risk assessment.

faq.question: What defines a major versus minor nonconformity?
faq.answer: Major nonconformities indicate systematic failure or absence of QMS requirements. Minor nonconformities are isolated incidents or partial implementation gaps requiring attention.

faq.question: How does audit findings integrate with CAPA?
faq.answer: Audit findings trigger CAPA initiation when corrective action is needed. The audit provides evidence while CAPA tracks root cause analysis, action implementation, and effectiveness verification.

faq.question: What auditor competencies are required by ISO 13485?
faq.answer: Auditors need ISO 13485 standard knowledge, medical device industry understanding, audit methodology training, and demonstrated personal attributes including independence and analytical thinking.

faq.question: How do I prepare for a certification body audit?
faq.answer: Complete internal audit cycles, close all major findings, verify document control accuracy, conduct management review, and perform a full mock audit simulation with realistic scenarios.
